.definition: the particular attitude or opinion that someone has about something
.example: They all had a different point of view.

.definition: to trust someone or something to do something for you
.example: He has no one else to rely on.

.definition: used to show that you do not think that the word or phrase that is being used to describe somebody/something is appropriate
.example: Any so called rumors are as easily their fault.

.definition: to separate something from a larger group
.example: They managed to sort out everything on their own.

.definition: to consider particular facts, circumstances, etc. when making a decision about something
.example: We take into account all scenarios.

.definition: (of a person) to arrive
.example: You have to turn up at 8 am

.definition: there is no more, that is everything
.example: That’s it for today, I’m afraid.

.definition: to have a plan or intention
.example: "Sounds like you have something in mind, Sarah," he said, taking her hand under the bar.

.definition: done for another person’s benefit or support, or because you are representing the interests of that person
.example: On behalf of his daughter, he sued.

.definition: to enjoy, like
.example: He doesn’t care for it very much in his tea.

.definition: to be in contact with
.example: Are you two at all in touch?

.definition: to do and all people know about it
.example: Also, the information cannot be known to the general public.

.definition: used to suggest something
.example: What about Lola - Shall we invite her?

.definition: used to start talking about someone or something
.example: As for the promotion, there may be other options.

.definition: to become familiar with something/ someone
.example: It may take a while to get used to.

.definition: working or involving the full number of hours considered normal or standard
.example: I’m a full time fan of his music.

.definition: to turn out to be
.example: We ended up going anyway.

.definition: to arrive at the place where one started, return
.example: What time will we get back?

.definition: to some extent; not completely
.example: It’s funny in a way.

.definition: used to introduce an explanation that is simpler than the one given earlier
.example: The groups are in other words conservative.

.definition: after everything has been considered
.example: In the end it’s like what they say about horses.

.definition: blocking someone's way
.example: I won’t stand in the way.

.definition: used when you are saying that something is likely
.example: She can and will no doubt improve over time.

.definition: at or from this moment, but not before
.example: He is busy at present writing a new novel

.definition: used to introduce a contrasting fact, etc. that must be considered
.example: We arrived at the same time.

.definition: without being prevented by something
.example: The sailors continued to travel in spite of rough seas.

.definition: each other
.example: Team members should communicate with one another.

.definition: (of parts) compose or constitute a whole
.example: Women make up 40 percent of the workforce.

.definition: To become interested in or passionate about something.
.example: Ugh, I just can't get into that show—the acting is terrible.

.definition: decide on something; choose something.
.example: Instead of butter, I always go for margarine or a low-fat spread.

.definition: to plan for a specific purpose; intend
.example: They aim to complete the project by the spring.

.definition: to be interesting or attractive
.example: Such music managed to appeal to the tastes of both young and old.

.definition: turn one's head from side to side in order to indicate refusal, denial, disapproval, or incredulity.
.example: He just shook his head and laughed.

.definition: used to emphasize how small an amount is
.example: No more than five of them had auto insurance.

.definition: used to express strong disappointment or disapproval.
.example: No one cared, not even when they saw the photos.

.definition: having a right to certain benefits, privileges or to do something
.example: You’re entitled to your opinion.

.definition: before a particular time or event
.example: Prior to the event, the organizers called the band.

.definition: decide on a course of action, typically after rejecting alternatives.
.example: You may choose to believe what the papers say.

.definition: close to, approximately
.example: It costs something like five dollars.

.definition: if something should happen
.example: In the event of an actual emergency, you will be told what to do.

.definition: used to introduce a common saying or a statement that expresses a common belief.
.example: They say it tastes like chicken.

.definition: in connection with something
.example: There was nothing in respect of drink.

.definition: used to show what something is made from
.example: The dress was made out of velvet

.definition: following in order or importance.
.example: Next to his sister, he was the best looking of them.

.definition: used for saying that it is not important which of two possibilities is true
.example: Whether or not you like it, I’m going out tonight.

.definition: working or ready to work; established
.example: There are systems in place to handle that.

.definition: used to show that what you have just said is only an example or you are not certain about it
.example: Why don't you go to a movie or something?

.definition: in a place a short distance away from you, or in another country
.example: He put it way over there.

.definition: to some extent though not entirely
.example: The cause of the illness is at least in part psychological

.definition: An exclamation or expression of alarm, concern, or resentment about a problem or error
.example: Oh no not again.

.definition: to indicate the subject that is being talked or written about
.example: There was some confusion with regard to payment.
